intro: Thunia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Plumbagaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Thunia species are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. They often have a compact growth habit and are prized for their ornamental value in gardens. Due to their salt tolerance, they are also used in coastal landscaping and restoration projects.
